Description: Hollow terracotta figure of Harpokrates, naked, lotus buds above his hair, riding a stallion. Flat-faced plinth. Back largely plain except for summary detail of the horse's head, and a horizontal groove defining the plinth, from which a piece is broken. Two-piece mould. Brown Nile silt, with very little mica.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Acquired in the Fayum. Probably Roman, first or second century AD. Bibliog. Budge 1925: pl. xxviii.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3070)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
